question: Ammonia reacts with oxygen to yield nitrogen and water,<image 1>,Given this chemical equation, as well as the number of moles of the reactant or product indicated below, determine the number of moles of all remaining reactants and products:. 3.0 mol O2
options: ['4.0 mol of NH3,3.0 mol of N2,6.0 mol of H2O', '4.0 mol of NH3,1.0 mol of N2,6.0 mol of H2O', '4.0 mol of NH3,2.0 mol of N2,6.0 mol of H2O']
description:
The image displays a balanced chemical equation for the reaction between ammonia (NH₃) and oxygen (O₂) to produce nitrogen gas (N₂) and liquid water (H₂O). The equation is written as follows:

\[ 4 \text{NH}_3(g) + 3 \text{O}_2(g) \longrightarrow 2 \text{N}_2(g) + 6 \text{H}_2\text{O}(l) \]

This indicates that 4 moles of ammonia gas react with 3 moles of oxygen gas to produce 2 moles of nitrogen gas and 6 moles of liquid water. The coefficients in front of each compound represent the stoichiometric ratios of the reactants and products involved in the reaction.
